Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: DerMarr Johnson's 3-pointer forged a tie with 51 seconds left and Jason Terry sank two clutch free throws with four seconds remaining as the Atlanta Hawks rallied for a 105-103 victory over the New Jersey Nets.
article.headline: Nets blow seven-point lead in final 3:28

images.name: Abdur-Rahim_Shareef 020212 inline
images.caption: Shareef Abdur-Rahim goes up for two of his game-high 34 points for the Hawks.

article.linkText: Hawks start second half with upset win over Nets
article.story:
ATLANTA (AP) -- New Jersey coach Byron Scott was hardly pleased after his Eastern Conference-leading Nets blew a seven-point lead with 3:28 remaining. To the lowly Atlanta Hawks, no less. "We just gave the game away, basically," Scott said. "I hope our guys understand a lot of teams are going to play us a lot more aggressive and a lot more physical. We have the best record in the East, so we have a target on our back." Jason Terry hit a pair of free throws with 4.4 seconds remaining, and Jason Kidd missed a straightaway 3-pointer as time expired in Atlanta's 105-103 victory. Shareef Abdur-Rahim led the Hawks with 34 points, setting a career-high by hitting all 16 of his free throws. Terry added 21 for Atlanta, which has won three of four and improved to 44-12 all-time at home against the Nets. The Hawks, who entered with a 16-33 record that was on pace to match last season's franchise-worst 25-57 mark, improved to just 4-21 when an opponent scores 100 points. Atlanta essentially won the game at the free throw line, hitting 18 of 24 attempts in the second half. "We got in foul trouble," Scott said. "That hurt us. We never really got into a real good rhythm." New Jersey had won two straight and three of four from the Hawks, but the Nets missed their last three shots, including Kidd's 12-foot baseline jumper that Jacque Vaughn rebounded with 14.9 seconds to go. The Nets were led by Kerry Kittles' 20 points, 16 from Keith Van Horn and 15 from reserve forward Richard Jefferson. Van Horn, Jefferson and center Todd MacCulloch each had five fouls, and Kenyon Martin, who played the second half with a sore wrist, had four. "I shot one shot after I hurt it," Martin said. "We just lost. I couldn't tell you why. They played a great game." Kidd, who entered with an NBA-best five triple-doubles, finished with 12 points, a team-high 14 rebounds and nine assists. "They made a great run at the end," Kidd said. "We didn't take care of the ball. You have to shut the door against a team that's dangerous. We left it open, and they came in." DerMarr Johnson, who scored a career-high 21 points for Atlanta, hit a 3-pointer -- his only basket of the second half -- from the right sideline to make it 103-103 with 50.9 seconds remaining. Kidd hit a fadeaway 16-foot rainbow shot from the right side to put New Jersey ahead 103-100 with 1:24 go, and Nazr Mohammed followed with two missed fouls shots. New Jersey, which has dropped two straight for the first time since Dec. 21-22, led by as many as 10 points -- the last time coming in the third quarter when Kidd fed Van Horn with a behind-the-back pass in the lane. Before ending the game with his two free throws, Terry was driving from the left side to the basket against Kittles when Kidd came in and committed the foul. "The last three minutes we were focused every possession," Terry said. "We had to get stops. I kept holding up -- 'One stop.' And that's all it took."

Game notes
Atlanta hopes to get F Toni Kukoc back next week. Kukoc had the cast removed from his right wrist, which he broke Jan. 9. ... Coach Lon Kruger said after the game that F Alan Henderson, who's missed the entire season with an inflamed right knee, could return sometime during a six-game West Coast road trip that begins Friday against the Lakers. ... On Thursday, the Nets will attempt to win consecutive games over the Pistons for the first time since April 18, 1998-February 15, 1999. New Jersey ended a seven-year winless streak at Detroit with an 88-75 victory on Dec. 27.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
